Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Passionately \Pas"sion*ate*ly\, adv. 1. In a passionate manner; with strong feeling; ardently. [1913 Webster]
Sorrow expresses itself . . . loudly and passionately. --South. [1913 Webster]
2. Angrily; irascibly. --Locke. [1913 Webster]
passionately adv 1: with passion; "she kissed him passionately" 2: in a stormy or violent manner [syn: {stormily}, {turbulently}]
